content.question: An ellipse is defined parametrically by <math alttext="x of t, equals,1 plus, 2 times cosine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals 3 times sine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 2 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the perimeter of the ellipse?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.3: (BC ONLY) Finding Arc Lengths of Curves Given by Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
